channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: When Australian dance teacher Elysia Baker picked up three internationally renowned salsa champions from Melbourne airport and brought them to her home in Macedon, she didn’t know they would soon become her roommates.
item.title: Stuck in Macedon, this house of salsa champions found a way to thrive

item.description: I support social distancing measures designed to stop COVID-19 spreading. I oppose them being enforced in a manner that has been seen as both totalitarian and inconsistent.
item.title: COVID-19 sees Victorian democracy fail behind closed doors

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Drivers are being licensed with only a few hours of experience behind the wheel of a heavy vehicle, prompting the government to consider new training rules.
item.title: Truck licensing shake-up looms after spike in crashes

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Charities and businesses are paying the price for an "alarming rise" in dumping as households clear unwanted items from their homes during social isolation.
item.title: 'Dumping is not donating': Charities hit by illegal rubbish crisis

item.description: Suddenly, we have the sweet plenitude of time on our hands. I notice rainbow lorikeets nuzzling in my neighbour’s banksia tree, chalked hopscotch on driveways, the mounds of leaves raked briefly into corners, the late blooming of blowsy summer roses bowing to the inevitable, dogs of all shapes and sizes taking their owners for a walk.
item.title: Faith column: Autumnal strolls revive our spirit and community

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Monash University scientists behind a study that promoted a head lice drug as a COVID-19 killer allegedly ignored warnings from other researchers the level of drug needed was up to 100 times higher than approved human doses.
item.title: Human trials begin despite warnings about Monash' COVID-19 head lice study

item.dc:creator: Michael Koziol
item.description: "Growing unease" within Liberal ranks about coronavirus restrictions never manifested in mass opposition. Why?
item.title: Inside the failed efforts to dismantle Australia's coronavirus response

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Millions of dollars of fresh produce is going to waste as the coronavirus ban on dining at cafes, restaurants and pubs continues without an end in sight.
item.title: Farmers ploughing fresh veggies back into soil as restaurant ban bites

item.dc:creator: Julie Szego
item.description: But go easy on all the walking.
item.title: The dogs are in our corner, as always

item.description: Our national stories aren’t always heroic or amusing but they are still ours and they need and deserve to be told by us, for us.
item.title: Pandemic could be last straw for already-struggling creatives

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: The state opposition has demanded the Andrews government immediately reopen schools to all students.
item.title: Victoria's political unity on schools turns into open warfare

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Up to 60 per cent of families at some independent schools have asked for fee relief.
item.title: Private schools give fee rebates to parents asking for COVID-19 relief

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: On how many fronts can you wage war and prevail? Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, are about to find out.
item.title: Harry and Meghan versus everyone else

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: How much value are you really getting from your private health cover? Now is the perfect time to ask.
item.title: Top 5 ways to save money on your health insurance

item.description: Anzac Day is a national holiday in Australia, with dawn services usually held across the country to mark the landing of Australian and New Zealand troops at Gallipoli during World War I. However social distancing measures meant Australians experienced a very differently Anzac Day this year.
item.title: Anzac Day 2020

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Scott Morrison says social distancing won't apply to schools, global COVID-19 cases surpass 2.7 million, Australian death toll stands at 81

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: If you think the game's departing chief executive looked relaxed, or even relieved, when he fronted the media after quitting, now you know why.
item.title: Greenberg's $650,000 parting gift from NRL

item.description: Comparison websites show administration fees charged by different funds but there are other charges that must be taken into account.
item.title: Comparing super fund 'apples with apples' not an easy task

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: Reactions to the health crisis will come under scrutiny from the powerful House of Representatives Standing Committee on Economics
item.title: Insurers face parliamentary probe on COVID-19 response

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Superquiz and Target, Sunday, April 26

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 26, 2020

item.description: Beecham House is an unintentionally hilarious attempt to go full Ivory Merchant on Downton Abbey.
item.title: What's on TV: Saturday, May 2

item.description: This week's victim is an anodyne suburban grandmother whose biggest dilemma in life was which of the Family Assorted biscuits to choose.
item.title: What's on TV: Friday, May 1

item.dc:creator: Jim Pavlidis
item.description: Like multi-tasking artist Dorothea Tanning, AFLW MVP Jasmine Garner is juggling multiple demands while trying to create a body of work of rare breadth and quality.
item.title: It's been a big week in art ... with Jim Pavlidis

item.dc:creator: Dilvin Yasa
item.description: Domestic violence doesn’t always take the form of physical attacks. As three women tell, emotional abuse can be just as threatening.
item.title: 'When someone uses their words to control you, no one sees your scars'

item.description: Cate Blanchett’s new TV series tells the story of American anti-feminist activist Phyllis Schlafly. She talks equality, isolating with the family and vacuuming.
item.title: Painting a picture: Cate Blanchett on life in isolation and her role in the gender debate

item.description: The comedian and actor discusses his career and the women who have influenced him.
item.title: Nazeem Hussain: New project scuttles myth that 'Muslim women are meek'

item.dc:creator: Nicole Economos
item.description: The shoe designer who usually fasts intermittently shares what she eats to keep energised while working.
item.title: My day on a Plate: Lisa Seskin

item.description: "A Territory girl finally learnt how to keep warm in Melbourne!"
item.title: Miranda Tapsell on the puffer jacket she can't live without

item.dc:creator: Adam Liaw
item.description: Save the heavy stuff for takeaway. Avoid the rich sauces and lighten up with your wok; Chinese home cooking is fast and simple.
item.title: Adam Liaw's steamed chicken with shiitake mushrooms and Chinese sausage, and tiger salad

item.description: Free weekly horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Weekly Horoscope for April 26 - May 3

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: If you wanted a poster boy for the correlation between globalisation and sport, tennis fits the bill.
item.title: Global travel a millstone for tennis in the time of pandemic

item.description: A selection of images that capture Anzac Day 2020 under COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: Anzac Day 2020 in pictures

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: This year should have been Jock Landale's year with an Olympics and a possible NBA debut on the cards.
item.title: Jock Landale looks to capitalise on time off the court

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Test veteran Kurtley Beale is missing from the first squad compiled by new Wallabies coach Dave Rennie and his assistants.
item.title: Struggling Beale on outer as Rennie names unofficial Wallabies squad

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The aged care facility has been hard hit by coronavirus after an outbreak started there this month.
item.title: Sixth Newmarch House resident dies, raising NSW's death toll to 34

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Former Sydney FC favourite Brandon O'Neill signed for Pohang Steelers in January, but will make his debut for the K-League outfit next month after a rocky road.
item.title: Culture shock, COVID-19 and cancer: Socceroo's Korean whirlwind

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Josh's parents Andrew and Belinda wrote of their joy at seeing Josh graduate from the Police Academy, having followed in his younger brother Alex's footsteps.
item.title: 'Protector and best mate': Family remembers fallen officer Josh Prestney

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: On August 9, 1941 two death notices appeared in The Age, one after the other, paying tribute to soldiers killed in active service.
item.title: Standing together, while apart as the Last Post fills the MCG

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Kevin Roberts faces arguably the most important week of his tenure at CA as the organisation tries to reunite the Australian cricket family.
item.title: Cricket Australia chief faces reckoning in bid to reunite game

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Two of Australia's favourite news-comedy shows are about to return to the air, with big changes on screen and off.
item.title: Have You Been Paying Attention, The Weekly return to a grave new world

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Countries that succeed in tackling their infection rates - such as Australia - have many different challenges but one common enemy - the coronavirus. We look at five places that acted early and tested widely in the fight against the pandemic.
item.title: Ahead of the curve: five other countries winning the battle against coronavirus

item.dc:creator: The Age's View
item.description: Australia's success at limiting the spread of coronavirus is triumph for us all, but now our unity is being tested.
item.title: Division is danger in fight against virus

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The good news for their fans is that Bad News, the hip-hop group's first album since 2006's Deeper You Dig, simply thumps.
item.title: Butterfingers are back and picking up the pieces with a new album

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Tommy Berry and Amangiri made the whole Hawkes family happy with her gutsy Hawkesbury Cup win at Rosehill.
item.title: Champagne to flow after Amangiri's Hawkesbury Cup success

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The two major political parties will seek access to the federal government's $130 billion JobKeeper program.
item.title: Liberals, ALP to seek taxpayer-funded wage subsidies for political staff

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Although open to discussing the issue, the AFLPA is yet to see a convincing argument for cutting list sizes while the AFL is looking to cut list numbers down to 35 over time.
item.title: List size debate heating up as 35 becomes target

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The coronavirus case total has risen to 1026. Police have fined 33 people in the past 24 hours for breaching public health directions. Since March 27, 1,354 fines have been dished out.
item.title: Queensland's weekly COVID-19 tally drops by more than two thirds

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Dozens of members of a suburban street in Melbourne's north-east gathered for a candle-lit dawn service, attended by babies in their mothers' arms and elderly couples alike.
item.title: 'Special feeling': A unique dawn service in a suburban street that will never be forgotten
